review.title: A Behavior Analysis-Based Game Bot Detection Approach Considering Various Play Styles
review.abstract: An approach for game bot detection in MMORPGs is proposed based on the analysis of game playing behavior. Since MMORPGs are large scale games, users can play in various ways. This variety in playing behavior makes it hard to detect game bots based on play behaviors. In order to cope with this problem, the proposed approach observes game playing behaviors of users and groups them by their behavioral similarities. Then, it develops a local bot detection model for each player group. Since the locally optimized models can more accurately detect game bots within each player group, the combination of those models brings about overall improvement. For a practical purpose of reducing the workloads of the game servers in service, the game data is collected at a low resolution in time. Behavioral features are selected and developed to accurately detect game bots with the low resolution data, considering common aspects of MMORPG playing. Through the experiment with the real data from a game currently in service, it is shown that the proposed local model approach yields more accurate results.

Since MMORPGs are large-scale game patterns, users can play behavioral patterns in different ways. However, this diversity in game behavior makes it difficult to detect game bots based on game behavior. To address this problem, the proposed approach can better recognize the game behaviors of users and groups that follow them based on their behavior patterns. It then develops a local detection model for each group of players. As the locally optimized models can more accurately detect game bots within each group of players, the combination of these models brings a general improvement. For a practical purpose of reducing the workload on game servers in the service, game data is collected in a low resolution. Behavioral functions are selected and developed to detect game bots with low resolution values.
